mdRecord.dcterms:title: Castle Warden, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Built in 1887 as the winter home of William G. Warden, a business partner of John D. Rockefeller and Henry Flagler. -- https://www.exploresouthernhistory.com/staugustineripley.html [work]

Renovated into a hotel in the 1940s by Pulitzer prize winning writer Majorie Kinnan Rawlings and her husband Norton Baskin. In 1950 Robert S. Ripley's family purchased the Castle Warden and opened the first Ripley's Believe It or Not Museum. -- https://www.visitstaugustine.com/gallery-image/castle-warden [work]
